justification: “In a series of eye-tracking studies, people who self-identified as more liberal focused more on the rising phase of a global temperature curve… This selective attention…” indicates that attentional bias was assessed with eye-tracking.

The article notes that “This selective attention is also shown in other studies using an attentional blink paradigm,” linking the construct of attentional bias to the attentional-blink task as its measurement method.
The same sentence reports that selective attention effects were found using “an attention cueing paradigm,” implying this paradigm was employed to measure attentional bias.
